result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua R. Langenhahn

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Micki 
Case Called: 4:01 p.m.
INCLUDES 18CF540, 19CF286, 20CF90, 20CF837, 20CF838, and 21CF1475

State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Defendant appears in person, with Attorney Cheryl Gill.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to: 
18CF540
COUNT 1: Possession of THC >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Possess Drug Paraphernalia >> DRI.
19CF286
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Felony >> DRI.
20CF90
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Felony >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Possess Drug Paraphernalia >> DRI.
COUNT 3: Possession of THC >> DRI.
20CF837
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Felony >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Criminal Damage to Property, Domestic Abuse >> DRI.
20CF838
COUNT 2: Bail Jumping - Felony >>DRI.
COUNT 3: Bail Jumping - Felony >> DRI.
22CF558
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Felony >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Possess Drug Paraphernalia >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to: 
18CF540
COUNT 3: Possession of Methamphetamine >> NO CONTEST. 
19CF286
COUNT 2: Battery, Domestic Abuse >> GUILTY.
COUNT 3: Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse >> NO CONTEST. 
20CF837
COUNT 3: Theft - Movable Property <=$2500, Domestic Abuse >> NO CONTEST.
20CF838
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Felony >> NO CONTEST. 
COUNT 4: Intentionally Point Firearm at Person >> NO CONTEST.
21CF1475
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Felony >> NO CONTEST.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 4 years probation on felony charges and 2 years probation on misdemeanor charges (except for 20CF837); CONDITIONS on all files: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; SAFE Program; AODA and f/u; Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week; Maintain absolute sobriety and no possession of alcohol or controlled substances, unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed, and with authorization from agent; Restitution on 19CF286 in the amount of $465.00 to J.B. plus 10% surcharge; No contact with victim(s): J.H. in 20CF837, M.M. in 20CF838 and J.B in 19CF286; three DV surcharges; DNA sample and surcharge; and CC. On 20CF837: 9 months jail with Huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination; No objection to EMP; 45 days to report to jail; and CC. Payment of CC on 20CF837 to be paid within 60 days or set up payment plan. 

Jail Credit:
21CF1475 - 2 days.
20CF837 - 72 days.
20CF838 - 72 days.
19CF286 - 2 days.
18CF540 - 0 days.

ADJ: 4:33 p.m.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 11, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

INCLUDES 18CF540, 19CF286, 20CF90, 20CF837, 20CF838, 21CF1475, 22CF558.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry in person. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Cheryl Gill in person.
VRCW.
Date and time set to address outstanding issues on this matter; Court recites history of the cases.
Court questions Atty Gill regarding her non appearance. Atty Gill makes statements. 
Court addresses Atty Gill and advises Atty Gill that she needs to appear in person for all future hearings.
DATES:
Plea Hearing to be scheduled with the JA.
Adjourned: 11:55 am

Hearing regarding Atty Gill's failure to appear on 9/12/2022 - 9/30/2022 @ 11:45pm
Set with Atty Gill and Atty Dury - must appear in person

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 1:52 pm 
INCLUDES 18CF540, 19CF286, 20CF90, 20CF837, 20CF838, 21CF1475, & 22CF558. 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Deft appears in person - Atty Cheryl Gill is NOT present. 
Date and Time was set for FPT. 
COURT notes Atty Gill was required to appear in person today. 
COURT notes Atty Gill has contacted coverage JA and requested Zoom info for today's hearing despite being directed to appear in person by the Court. 
COURT requires ALL parties, including Atty Gill, to appear in person at next scheduled in Court date to address FPT and for Atty Gill to explain her nonappearance today and explain why she should not be held in contempt for fail to follow Court's directive to appear in person today. 
COURT directs Public Defender's Office have Atty Drury or her designee present at next in Court appearance. 
CC set for 9/21/2022 at 1:00 pm to reset FPT/Hearing on Atty Gills' failure to appear. 

cc: Public Defender's Office
Final pre-trial on September 12, 2022 at 01:35 pm.

Clerk: Amanda.

INCLUDES: 18CF540 19CF286 205CF90 20CF837 20CF838 21CF1475 22CF558.

VRCW.
